ygData.subject: Re: Faction shmaction
ygData.msgSnippet: Hear! Hear! faction standings really are an iffy thing, cuz one may have or not have, as the case may be a decent standing and may get wacked and our brother
ygData.messageBody:
Hear! Hear!
faction standings really are an iffy thing, cuz one may have or not
have, as the case may be a decent standing and may get wacked and our
brother monk said, without warning.

Also, I tried out a Troll in the beta and had a lot of fun with her
but now if I play a troll, there is no way I can go into qeynos or
any of the other civilized cities. So it kinda limits your play.
But picture this, a Troll warrior grouped up with some high elven
wizards, in a dungeon!!!!! talk about kicking some monster tail!!
hehe but how can it happen??? no way I know of.. *sigh*

Also someone needs to let EQ know they gotta work on their player
to player communication; it's, in my opinion, incredibly combersome.
Does not lend itself to striking up casual conversations.
Don't get me wrong, I really like this game and I still think its
yards ahead of UO but......
Kebas/Rugga/Zardoz


----Original Message Follows----
From: Virginia Renaut <vrenaut@...>
Reply-To: Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com
To: bristlebane_eq@onelist.com
Subject: [Bristlebane_EQ] Faction shmaction
Date: 20 Apr 99 19:10:36 CDT

From: Virginia Renaut <vrenaut@...>

Other than seeing those occasional "your faction has increased with
So-and-so"
messages, does anyone else find it scary that you have NO idea what
any
particular group might think of you and what that means for your
general
safety?

Members of the crew I regularly adventure with made a few enemies
among the
Freeport militia. Now many of the Freeport guards will attack them.
Ok, that
one was fairly predictable. However, when we adventured to Kaladim,
one of
these people was killed by a dwarven guard (StormGuard). I'm not
sure that we
figured out exactly why. The guard shouted something about his god,
but he
shares a god with others in our group. Was it related to the
Freeport thing?
We may never know.

I wish they would tell you when you select your god what the
repercussions
might be. Picking one of the ultra-evil ones has obvious drawbacks,
but we
have no way of knowing what selecting any of the others will do to
you. And
once in the game what are you supposed to do? Two PCs conning an NPC
often
results in similar messages ("regards you dubiously" or something
like that)
yet only one PC will be attacked. Kind of an expensive guessing game.

Just my ponder for the day. Talk amongst yourselves.

Phoeble, Monk of Freeport, Almost Last-Named
